phrases: Howwonderful itwould be, to be like Hakim...
Sometimes, I am jealous of him.
Come now, you have to stay still.
It is harder than I expected.
I had a dream just now.
How many years has it been?
My mistress married when she was 18.
She Iost her husband when she was 20, becoming a widow.
After working as a governess for 30 years, she retired,
and has Iived here ever since.
It has gotten a bit cold.
My mistress rarely talks about her past.
That is all I really know of it.
Mr. and Mrs. Knox will be joining me for dinner tonight.
How is it, do we have enough?
I think we will be all right.
It all depends on the menu, though.
I cannot believe I invited them, and then forgot...
It is fortunate that I remembered.
Let us see, there is the coke...
Oh yes, and candles need to be brought out.
It is all right, I will set the table.
Do the best you can, dear.
It seems a shame to open this, but I guess it is all right.
The rain soaked through, and the wallpaper has...
By the way, what about your work, mate?
No one at work even knows that I am here.
My guests will be here soon.
It is not my fault that it rained!
The paper'll have to be changed.
You will take care of it then, will not you?
You know, this house really has seen better days.
We are so old, the both of us.
I will have to check my schedule.
Next time I am free, I will stop by.
As I understand it, you are always free during the day.
Looks like your guests are here.
I will use the back door.
Eh, the kitchen is fine with me.
Old Kelly is not very good with people.
It must be hard on you, too.
The mistress has always been good to me.
Did she say that the Knoxes were coming tonight?
Do not you have anything else?
This stuff's too good for them.
It is just that my mistress said the same thing.
Have you known the mistress for a long time?
Her late husband Doug and I were good friends.
That is why Kelly occasionally asks me to help out.
When we were young, we used to pinch apples together in Covent Garden.
Has not Kelly ever told you about her past?
But only that her husband died.
Were you friends with my mistress too?
I just wondered where the mistress and her husband had met...
Nowhere, it was an arranged marriage.
I think they married after meeting three times.
But even so, when it came to her husband, she-
Well then, guess it is time to go!
Well then, guess it is time to go!
It seems the Knoxes are not coming.
Emma, it would be a shame to let your hard work go to waste...
Eh?...so let us enjoy this meal together, all three of us.
You are certainly off form today.
You have done nothing but miss.
On the other hand, your lndian friend cannot do anything wrong.
It is as though he does not have a care in the world.
Al, you are not as strong with alcohol as you used to be.
I have always been weak where ladies and fine wine are concerned!
I will have two or three rolls if I can.
You would not think it to look at her now, but Kelly was once a beauty.
You should be silent when you eat.
Even though it was an arranged marriage, Doug fell in love with Kelly at first sight.
I could tell she was stubborn, so I tried to warn him...
I can hear you, you know.
She was tart with me, but always so kind to Doug.
Well then, guess I will fetch some more wine.
He may be old, but a bottle of wine will not hurt him.
He is a good man, Mr. Al.
I worry that he is still on his own.
You were 15 when you came here.
I had left the Jones' employ as a governess,
and had just retired to this house...
It is been five years since then...
What are your thoughts on Young Master William?
Will you turn him down too?
I have never met anyone like him.
Although he is of the gentry,
he does not seem to notice that I am a maid...
It is true... that young man can be rather careless.
He does not ask me simple yes or no questions like others do...
What has William been up to recently?
He appears to be wasting a great deal of time goofing off with Hakim.
Master William spends much of his time at the residence of Mrs. Stownar.
You mean his former governess, Kelly Stownar?
Master William is a thoughtful young man.
He seems concerned about his aging governess.
I do not believe there is any because for concern.
He is been gone a long time.
Please tell him that I have retired to bed.
The mistress has retired to bed, and asked me to say goodnight to you.
In that case, I will retire too.
I turned back to get a book I was reading, but I lost my footing...
Thanks to you, I am completely sober now!
Emma, can you check the staircase later?
I seem to have lost my old-
I think I managed to gather most of it...
The string must have broken, then.
Just leave it as it is.
Al, I am sorry, but might l ask you to do one more job?
Honestly, you really are not very good with people, are you?
I tried my hand at fixing it.
It is as good as new!
I used this photograph as a guide.
It is such a lovely necklace.
Was it a present from your husband?
I would like you to have this.
It does not suit me anymore.
I am sure Doug would be happy for you to have it.
Then, could you take a look at the gutters out back next?
It seems as though the rain is leaking in.
Emma, could you make a pot of tea please?
Of course that is what you would say.
Well, it is a nice keepsake.
I plan on having one taken every year.
You have to stay still for so long.
Oh dear, we have run out of sugar.
Say Al, can you run and buy some for us?
I cannot ask him to run errands.
She is so bad with people...
